issue.title: Wind plugin moved to world plugin

content.raw:
I agree Brian,

We defiantly should wait until the wave visualization issue is merged to move the ave plugin. In the mean time, I''ll edit this issue for only wind and create another issue for moving the wave plugin so we don't forget about it.

As far as the wind issues:

1\. I think that for early steps, the coefficients for each model could be passed to the plugin via world file.   

2\. I would think that we can assume a single prevailing wind for the whole course especially since the things we want to be influenced by the wind \(wamv and dock/light buoy/ect...\) will be sufficiently close together. Maybe there could be another feature of the plugin to save on computation by only modeling the wind for the non-wamv objects when the wam-v is sufficiently close
content.html:
I agree Brian,

We defiantly should wait until the wave visualization issue is merged to move the ave plugin. In the mean time, I''ll edit this issue for only wind and create another issue for moving the wave plugin so we don't forget about it.

As far as the wind issues:

1. I think that for early steps, the coefficients for each model could be passed to the plugin via world file.

2. I would think that we can assume a single prevailing wind for the whole course especially since the things we want to be influenced by the wind (wamv and dock/light buoy/ect...) will be sufficiently close together. Maybe there could be another feature of the plugin to save on computation by only modeling the wind for the non-wamv objects when the wam-v is sufficiently close
